Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #413255 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000CNNBW:ref - Security issue    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0CNNBW:ref ]

TextBody:
Hello,
 
Thank you for your reply.
I will share below the vulnerabilities the mentioned link presented:
 
Vulnerability


	
		
			Title
			Affected Component
			Affected Versions
			CVSS 4.0 Score
			CVSS 3.1 Score (Base / Temporal)
			Description
		
		
			Insufficient input validation in file upload (CVE-2024-36072)
			CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
			CoSoSys Unify
			<= 5.9.3.0
			<= 7.0.6
			10.0
			10.0 / 9.0
			A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the logging component of the Endpoint Protector and Unify server application which allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to send a malicious request, resulting in the ability to execute system commands with root privileges.
		
		
			Insufficient input validation in shadow function (CVE-2024-36073)
			CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
			CoSoSys Unify
			<= 5.9.3.0
			<= 7.0.6
			8.5
			9.1 / 8.2
			A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the shadowing component of the Endpoint Protector and Unify agent which allows an attacker with administrative access to the Endpoint Protector or Unify server to overwrite sensitive configuration and subsequently execute system commands with SYSTEM/root privileges on a chosen client endpoint.
		
		
			Insufficient validation of third-party resource acquisition (CVE-2024-36074)
			CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
			CoSoSys Unify
			<= 5.9.3.0
			<= 7.0.6
			7.3
			7.2 / 6.5
			A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Endpoint Protector and Unify agent in the way that the EasyLock dependency is acquired from the server. An attacker with administrative access to the Endpoint Protector or Unify server can cause a client to acquire and execute a malicious file resulting in remote code execution.
		
		
			Insufficient input validation in application configuration (CVE-2024-36075)
			CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
			CoSoSys Unify
			<= 5.9.3.0
			<= 7.0.6
			7.2
			8.0 / 7.2
			A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the application configuration component of the Endpoint Protector and Unify agent which allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to manipulate the configuration of either their own or another client endpoint resulting in the bypass of certain configuration options. Manipulation of the application configuration can result in local policy bypass and in some scenarios remote code execution.
		
	


 
In order to fix this, there is a hotfix available in Dashboard > Live update > Check Now, you can select it and press below "Apply Updates" to be applied in your system. Please note this Hotfix is strongly recommended to be applied to the version 5.9.3.0. If you do not wish to update the version to 5.9.3.0, there is a offline patch that I can share with you, if requested, so that you can apply it for older server versions (5.6.0.0 to 5.9.3.0).
 
 
Best regards,
Alin Anca
 
Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix - DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
CoSoSys Ltd www.endpointprotector.com

Hello,
 
Thank you for your reply.
I will share below the vulnerabilities the mentioned link presented:
 
Vulnerability 


Title

Affected Component

Affected Versions

CVSS 4.0 Score

CVSS 3.1 Score (Base / Temporal)

Description


Insufficient input validation in file upload (CVE-2024-36072)

CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
CoSoSys Unify

<= 5.9.3.0
<= 7.0.6

 
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/4.0#CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:N/UI:N
/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/S:N/AU:Y/R:U/V:D/RE:H/U:Red> 10.0

10.0 / 9.0
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.1#CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:C/
C:H/I:H/A:H/E:P/RL:O/RC:C> 

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the logging component of the
Endpoint Protector and Unify server application which allows an
unauthenticated remote attacker to send a malicious request, resulting in
the ability to execute system commands with root privileges.


Insufficient input validation in shadow function (CVE-2024-36073)

CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
CoSoSys Unify

<= 5.9.3.0
<= 7.0.6

 
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/4.0#CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N
/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/E:P/AU:Y/R:U/V:C/RE:H/U:Red> 8.5

9.1 / 8.2
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.1#CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:C/
C:H/I:H/A:H/E:P/RL:O/RC:C> 

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the shadowing component of
the Endpoint Protector and Unify agent which allows an attacker with
administrative access to the Endpoint Protector or Unify server to overwrite
sensitive configuration and subsequently execute system commands with
SYSTEM/root privileges on a chosen client endpoint.


Insufficient validation of third-party resource acquisition (CVE-2024-36074)

CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
CoSoSys Unify

<= 5.9.3.0
<= 7.0.6

 
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/4.0#CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:H/UI:N
/VC:H/VI:H/VA:H/SC:N/SI:N/SA:N/E:P/AU:Y/R:U/V:D/RE:H/U:Red> 7.3

7.2 / 6.5
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.1#CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/
C:H/I:H/A:H/E:P/RL:O/RC:C> 

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the Endpoint Protector and
Unify agent in the way that the EasyLock dependency is acquired from the
server. An attacker with administrative access to the Endpoint Protector or
Unify server can cause a client to acquire and execute a malicious file
resulting in remote code execution.


Insufficient input validation in application configuration (CVE-2024-36075)

CoSoSys Endpoint Protector
CoSoSys Unify

<= 5.9.3.0
<= 7.0.6

 
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/4.0#CVSS:4.0/AV:N/AC:L/AT:N/PR:L/UI:P
/VC:N/VI:H/VA:N/SC:H/SI:H/SA:H/E:P/AU:N/R:U/V:C/RE:H/U:Red> 7.2

8.0 / 7.2
<https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.1#CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/
C:H/I:H/A:H/E:P/RL:O/RC:C> 

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in the application
configuration component of the Endpoint Protector and Unify agent which
allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to manipulate the configuration of
either their own or another client endpoint resulting in the bypass of
certain configuration options. Manipulation of the application configuration
can result in local policy bypass and in some scenarios remote code
execution.

 
In order to fix this, there is a hotfix available in Dashboard > Live update
> Check Now, you can select it and press below "Apply Updates" to be applied
in your system. Please note this Hotfix is strongly recommended to be
applied to the version 5.9.3.0. If you do not wish to update the version to
5.9.3.0, there is a offline patch that I can share with you, if requested,
so that you can apply it for older server versions (5.6.0.0 to 5.9.3.0).
 
 
Best regards,
